summary: Fix skills progress bar flickering by ensuring proper initial state and animation timing. The issue occurs because progress bars don't have an explicit initial width of 0%, causing a visual glitch when the 300ms timeout triggers the width animation with a 1s CSS transition.

action_plan.description: Set explicit initial width of 0% for skill progress bars in CSS to prevent flickering
Modify renderSkills function to ensure progress bars start with 0% width when created
Optimize animateSkillBar function timing to reduce the 300ms delay and ensure smooth animation
Add CSS class for initial state management to prevent layout shifts during animation
Test the fix locally by serving the website and scrolling to skills section
Verify animation works smoothly across different browsers and screen sizes

risks: Animation timing changes might affect other scroll-triggered animations
CSS changes could impact mobile responsiveness of skill bars
Browser compatibility issues with CSS transitions
dependencies: CSS transition support in target browsers
Local development server for testing (python -m http.server or npx serve)
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
